name: NMGN
description: A description of the schema containing one or more templates.

WhitespaceMinimizedString.name: WhitespaceMinimizedString
WhitespaceMinimizedString.description: A string that has all whitespace trimmed off of beginning and end, and all internal whitespace segments reduced to single spaces. Whitespace includes #x9 (tab), #xA (linefeed), and #xD (carriage return).

Provenance.name: Provenance
Provenance.description: A field containing a DataHarmonizer versioning marker. It is issued by DataHarmonizer when validation is applied to a given row of data.

string.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

integer.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

boolean.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

uriorcurie.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

curie.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

ncname.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

jsonpointer.name: jsonpointer
jsonpointer.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

jsonpath.name: jsonpath
jsonpath.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

sparqlpath.name: sparqlpath
sparqlpath.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".

null value menu.name: null value menu
null value menu.description: A menu of data collection status options for this field.
null value menu.title: null value menu

host_sex_options.name: host_sex_options
host_sex_options.description: gender or sex of the host
host_sex_options.title: host_sex_options

Permitted_countries_menu.name: Permitted_countries_menu
Permitted_countries_menu.description: A list of permitted countires accepted by ENA
Permitted_countries_menu.title: Permitted_countries_menu

South Georgia and the South Sandwich Isl.text: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedoni.text: The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

Permitted_Facilities_menu.name: Permitted_Facilities_menu
Permitted_Facilities_menu.description: A list of institutes-facilities (18) used by the NMGN microbiome cluster for mouse studies
Permitted_Facilities_menu.title: Permitted_Facilities_menu

UE Queen's Medical Research Institute-Ce.text: UE Queen's Medical Research Institute-Centre for Cardiovascular Science

cage_manufacturer_menu.name: cage_manufacturer_menu
cage_manufacturer_menu.description: a list of manufacturers that the mouse cages are sourced from.
cage_manufacturer_menu.title: cage_manufacturer_menu

nutrition_diet_types_option.name: nutrition_diet_types_option
nutrition_diet_types_option.description: a list of diet types that can be provided to the NMGN mice.
nutrition_diet_types_option.title: nutrition_diet_types_option

tax_id_menu.name: tax_id_menu
tax_id_menu.description: Taxonomic identification of the organism(s) collected as in the NCBI Taxonomy database
tax_id_menu.title: tax_id_menu

sample_title.name: sample_title
sample_title.title: sample_title
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

sample_alias.name: sample_alias
sample_alias.description: Unique name of the sample. If not selected system will automatically use the ENA sample accession as the sample ID
sample_alias.title: sample_alias
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

sample_description.name: sample_description
sample_description.title: sample_description
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

examples.value: fecal sample collected from syk mouse gut

tax_id.name: tax_id
tax_id.description: Taxonomy ID of the organism as in the NCBI Taxonomy database. Entries in the NCBI Taxonomy database have integer taxon IDs.
tax_id.title: tax_id
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

sample collection method.name: sample collection method
sample collection method.description: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text
sample collection method.title: sample collection method
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

sample derived from.name: sample derived from
sample derived from.description: Reference to parental sample(s) or original run(s) that the assembly is derived from. The referenced samples or runs should already be registered in INSDC. This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample/run e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx OR a range e.g. ERSxxxxxx-ERSxxxxxx
sample derived from.title: sample derived from
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

broad-scale environmental context.name: broad-scale environmental context
broad-scale environmental context.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvOÕs biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
broad-scale environmental context.title: broad-scale environmental context
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

local environmental context.name: local environmental context
local environmental context.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimenÕs local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
local environmental context.title: local environmental context
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

environmental medium.name: environmental medium
environmental medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
environmental medium.title: environmental medium
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

collection date.name: collection date
collection date.description: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.
collection date.title: collection date
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

project name.name: project name
project name.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
project name.title: project name
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

geographic location (country and/or sea).name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
geographic location (country and/or sea).description: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
geographic location (country and/or sea).title: geographic location (country and/or sea)
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

geographic location (latitude).name: geographic location (latitude)
geographic location (latitude).description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
geographic location (latitude).title: geographic location (latitude)
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

geographic location (longitude).name: geographic location (longitude)
geographic location (longitude).description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
geographic location (longitude).title: geographic location (longitude)
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

host taxid.name: host taxid
host taxid.description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 10090
host taxid.title: host taxid
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

host scientific name.name: host scientific name
host scientific name.description: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained. Note this needs to correspond to the host taxid (e.g. Mus musculus -> 10090)
host scientific name.title: host scientific name
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

institute_facility.name: institute_facility
institute_facility.description: Name of Institute-[animal] facility the mouse was last housed in
institute_facility.title: institute_facility
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

nutrition_diet_type.name: nutrition_diet_type
nutrition_diet_type.title: nutrition_diet_type
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas

cage_manufacturer.name: cage_manufacturer
cage_manufacturer.description: name of manufacturer that the cage was sourced from
cage_manufacturer.title: cage_manufacturer
comments: any additional comments, can have multiple, seperated by commas
